name: .ICAP File Extension
summary: Learn about .ICAP files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An ICAP file is a package created by Adobe InDesign for use in Adobe InCopy, a writing and editing application. It stores an .ICMA file and associated .ICML files in a compressed archive. ICAP files are used to store subsections of InDesign documents, such as a text or graphics frame, for remote editing by an InCopy user.

content: Adobe developed the ICAP format for when InCopy and InDesign users work collaboratively via ICMA assignment files but do not have access to a common server where the ICMA files are stored. The users may not have the correct permissions, access to the Internet, etc.

An InDesign user can create and distribute an ICAP package that stores the ICMA assignment files to an InCopy user. The InCopy user can then edit it with InCopy, re-package it as an .IDAP file, and send it back to the InDesign user to import it into the original .INDD document using InDesign.
To create an ICAP file with InDesign:
Create an assignment and add the content to be included in the package (only checked content is included in the package)
Select the assignment in the "Assignments" panel in InDesign
Choose Package for InCopy from the panel menu, name the package, choose the save location, and click Save
NOTE: ICAP files are used by InCopy and InDesign CS4 and later. Previous versions used the .INCP extension.

instructions: You can open ICAP files with Adobe InCopy in Windows and macOS. To open it with InCopy, select File → Open..., navigate to your file, select it, and click Open. Or, select Open Package in the "Assignments" panel menu and choose the ICAP file.

You can also open ICAP files with Adobe InDesign in Windows and macOS. To open it with InDesign, select File → Open..., navigate to your file, select it, and click Open. Or, select Open Package in the "Assignments" panel menu and choose the ICAP file.
